intro: Waltheria ferruginea, commonly known as the rusty leaf mallow, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, ovate leaves and showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in late spring. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in woodland or open areas. Waltheria ferruginea is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to grow in gardens.
